repnme.cdata!:
Czech Republic - Biodiversity protection :
            global environmental facility (GEF)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Czech Republic biodiversity
            protection project was designed as a project for the former
            Czechoslovakia and was first identified in late 1992 and
            early 1993, when it was then divided into two related but
            separate projects for the new Czech and Slovak Republics. A
            key objective of the global environmental facility (GEF)
            pilot phase was to seek innovative and replicable solutions
            to global environmental challenges. Project activities were
            divided into three programmatic areas: the biodiversity
            protection program; the conservation program; and the
            institutional infrastructure improvement program.

23954996.trustfund:
BBGEF-BB GLOBAL ENVIRONMENTAL FUND,TF028617-GET-CZECH BIODIVERSITY
            PROTECTION PROJ.,TF029053-GEF1-EPPG CZECH ENABLING
            ACTIVITIES PROPOSAL IN BIODIVERSITY,TF031024-POLAND & SLOVAK REPUBLIC -
            FORESTRY; BIODIVERSITY PROTECTION

abstracts.cdata!:
The grant funded activities covered the
            preparation of two reports-a biodiversity strategy and
            action plan (BSAP) and a national report. The BSAP component
            involved the formulation and adoption of strategies and
            actions necessary for the protection and sustainable use of
            the recipient's biodiversity, through a participatory
            process that includes public and private sectors and
            non-governmental organizations (NGOs). The national report
            component covered the full range of activities undertaken by
            the recipient in accordance with its obligations under the
            convention on biological diversity.
